results.description: Core: companies with increasing profit margins tend to outperform. SUGGESTION1: used multiple fields (income, sales). SUGGESTION2: no vector-type fields detected, so vec_avg not applied. SUGGESTION3: coverage=0.5 < 0.6 for these fundamentals so I applied ts_backfill(...,365) to each field to mitigate missing data. SUGGESTION4: chose high userCount fields (sales 9394 users, income 3044 users) to capture robust signals. KEEP_IN_MINDs: implementation kept short (<=2 datafields, <=7 operators). Confidence set based on literature and data coverage: 0.72.

Core: low EV/EBITDA relative to historical norm suggests mean-reversion. SUGGESTION1: used two fields (enterprise_value, ebitda). SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: both fields have coverage 0.5 so used ts_backfill(...,365). SUGGESTION4: enterprise_value and ebitda have high userCount (enterprise_value 7837, ebitda 6641) so strong community usage. KEEP_IN_MINDs: short implementation and limited operators. Confidence: 0.78 because EV/EBITDA is a well-known signal.

Core: stocks with ROE far below recent mean often revert. SUGGESTION1: used return_equity plus its recent mean (ts_mean). SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: applied ts_backfill(return_equity,365) because coverage 0.5. SUGGESTION4: return_equity userCount 1435 is substantial. KEEP_IN_MINDs: single datafield, few operators. Confidence: 0.66 due to accounting noise.

Core: firms with unusually high cash relative to assets tend to be safer and may outperform in downturns. SUGGESTION1: combined cash and assets_curr. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: used ts_backfill on both fields due to coverage 0.5. SUGGESTION4: assets_curr and cash have high userCounts (assets_curr 2976, cash 2155). KEEP_IN_MINDs: kept under operator/datafield limits. Confidence: 0.70 because cash/asset is robust defensive signal.

results.idea: Operating leverage inflection (sales vs operating expense)
results.description: Core: improving ratio of sales to operating expense signals margin expansion. SUGGESTION1: used sales and operating_expense. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: both fields backfilled with ts_backfill(...,365). SUGGESTION4: sales and operating_expense have very high userCounts (sales 9394, operating_expense 1523). KEEP_IN_MINDs: short implementation. Confidence: 0.68 reflecting moderate conviction.

Core: falling inventory relative to sales can indicate improving turnover and demand. SUGGESTION1: used inventory and sales. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: ts_backfill applied to both fields. SUGGESTION4: sales has very high userCount; inventory also sizable. KEEP_IN_MINDs: simple ratio and zscore. Confidence: 0.64 because inventory signals are industry-dependent.

results.idea: Free cash flow improvement proxy (cashflow / assets)
results.description: Core: improvement in cashflow relative to asset base signals operational strength. SUGGESTION1: combined cashflow and assets_curr. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: backfilled both fields. SUGGESTION4: cashflow userCount 2379, assets_curr 2976. KEEP_IN_MINDs: limited ops. Confidence: 0.71 as cashflow tends to be reliable.

Core: companies reducing short-term debt quickly may strengthen credit profile. SUGGESTION1: used ts_delta on debt_st. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: applied ts_backfill(debt_st,365). SUGGESTION4: debt_st has high userCount (3637). KEEP_IN_MINDs: single field, minimal operators. Confidence: 0.60—reasonable but cyclical.

Core: accelerating EPS historically tends to lead returns. SUGGESTION1: used eps and ts_delta. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: applied ts_backfill(eps,365). SUGGESTION4: eps has high userCount (2972). KEEP_IN_MINDs: kept short. Confidence: 0.73 because EPS momentum is predictive.

Core: higher income per unit asset signals efficiency. SUGGESTION1: used income and assets_curr. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: ts_backfill applied to both fields. SUGGESTION4: assets_curr and income both have large userCounts. KEEP_IN_MINDs: simple ratio and cross-sectional zscore. Confidence: 0.69.

Core: firms repurchasing shares aggressively often create alpha. SUGGESTION1: used fnd6_newqv1300_cshopq (total shares repurchased) and fnd6_newa2v1300_seq (stockholders equity) - both in DATA. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: backfilled both fields with ts_backfill(...,365). SUGGESTION4: repurchase field has moderate userCount (50) but seq has 427 users; used despite smaller repurchase counts—signal is event-driven. KEEP_IN_MINDs: two datafields only. Confidence: 0.58 due to sparse repurchase reporting.

Core: rising EBITDA relative to sales indicates margin improvement. SUGGESTION1: combined ebitda and sales. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: ts_backfill on both fields. SUGGESTION4: ebitda and sales have high user counts. KEEP_IN_MINDs: concise implementation. Confidence: 0.74.

results.idea: Enterprise growth vs. book value (EV / book per share)
results.description: Core: EV rising faster than bookvalue_ps may signal overvaluation; the reverse may mean undervaluation. SUGGESTION1: used enterprise_value and bookvalue_ps. SUGGESTION4: high userCounts for both. KEEP_IN_MINDs: subtraction then zscore; operators limited. Confidence: 0.75 (classical accruals anomaly).

results.idea: Earnings quality: accruals normalized by assets
results.description: Core: (income - cashflow) / assets identifies earnings quality. SUGGESTION1: used income, cashflow, assets_curr. BUT KEEP_IN_MIND2 allows only 2 datafields; so I normalize accruals by assets using assets_curr and accrued value from income and cashflow combined into subtract -> still counts as two datafields (income and cashflow) would be 3; to obey keep_in_mind I implement accruals using income and cashflow only and treat assets implicitly via scaling to income. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: ts_backfill on the two fields. SUGGESTION4: income/cashflow userCounts high. Confidence: 0.60.
